content: n b k othing ut nit child sized mitten pattern supplies needed size 6 circular or double pointed needles or size needed to obtain gauge ◦ 5 stitches and 7 row = 1 in stockinette stitch worsted weight yarn in gray white black and orange tapestry needle finished sizes small approx 5 75 circumference 6 5 total length medium approx 6 5 circumference 7 5 total length large approx 7 circumference 8 75 total length using gray yarn cast on 28 32 36 sts and join in the round being careful not to twist round 1 p round 2-5 k round 6 *insert right needle between the 2nd and 3rd stitches on the left needle and down 3 row draw up a loop of white yarn slip next 4 stitches purlwise slip one leg of the white stitch over the 4 slipped stitches * repeat to end of round note keep white stitches very loose round 7-9 using gray yarn k round 10 k2 *insert right needle 2 stitches over and 3 row down at the top of the white zig-zag from round 6 and draw up a loop of white yarn slip next 4 stitches purlwise slip one leg of the white stitch over the 4 slipped stitches* repeat until there are 2 stitches left in the round insert needle 2 stitches over and 3 row down draw up a loop of white yarn slip the last 2 stitches of round 10 and the first 2 stitches of round 11 slip one leg of the white stitch over the 4 slipped stitches round 11 using gray yarn k remaining stitches in this round rounds 12-19 repeat rounds 4-11 small and medium sizes only round 20 using gray yarn k round 21 using black yarn k round 22 repeat round 6 round 23 using black yarn p large size only rounds 20-27 repeat rounds 4-11 round 28 using gray yarn k round 29 using black yarn k round 30 repeat round 6 round 31 using black yarn p follow chart for the top of the mitten the thumb stitches are shown with a yellow line left-hand mitten and a red line right-hand mitten knit these stitches onto a piece of scrap yarn transfer back to the left needle and knit again with your working yarn continue following the chart after the final round cut yarn and pull through the remaining stitches tighten and secure small size 28 sts k2tog ssk right thumb left thumb medium size 32 sts large size 36 sts for the thumb pick up the stitches below the scrap yarn and the stitches above the scrap yarn plus one on each side 12 stitches for small and medium size 14 stitches for large size remove the scrap yarn knit in the round until thumb measures approx 1 75 for small size 2-2 25 for medium size or 2 5 for large size or required thumb length on next round k2tog to the end of the round cut
